meanings.definition: Eds: a shortened form of the word "editors"
meanings.sent1: The eds of the newspaper work hard to ensure accurate information.
meanings.sent2: The eds at the publishing house review and approve the final content.
meanings.sent3: The eds had a meeting to discuss the upcoming articles, and it turned into a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The eds are like conductors orchestrating the flow of information in the publication.
meanings.sent5: The eds are the guardians of truth in the world of journalism.

meanings.definition: Eds: a shortened form of the word "education"
meanings.sent1: Access to quality eds is essential for a brighter future.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her life to providing eds to underprivileged children.
meanings.sent3: The eds system in the country underwent significant reforms to improve outcomes.
meanings.sent4: Eds are the keys that unlock the doors to knowledge and opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The power of eds can transform lives and shape societies.

meanings.definition: Eds: a shortened form of the word "editions"
meanings.sent1: The bookstore received the latest eds of popular novels.
meanings.sent2: Collectors eagerly seek out rare eds of classic books.
meanings.sent3: The limited eds of the magazine sold out within hours of release.
meanings.sent4: Each new eds of the dictionary reflects the evolving language.
meanings.sent5: The special eds of the album included bonus tracks and behind-the-scenes footage.
